Articles.Content:
Go to this link and install: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/24926-0-21-Kerbal-LiveFeed-Passive-Multiplayer-Plugin-Client-Server-v0-7-1?highlight=live%20feed

Firewall

Step 1. Go to control pannel

Step 2. Go to windows firewall (windows 7)

Step 3. Click on turn windows firewall on or off

Step 4. Turn it off (Don't worry it's okay!)

Pre-Setup (Must Have Done Firewall)

Step 1. Download LogMeIn Hamachi

Step 2. Click network

Step 3. Click Join Existing Network

Step 4. Type 'KSP Multiplayer!' for Network Name

Step 5. Type 123 for Password

Connecting (Must Do Pre-Setup)

Step 1. Run KLFC.exe

Step 2. Type IP

Step 3. Type 25.141.111.136

Step 4. Click C

FAQ

Will I be able to interact and or dock with other ships?

No

Will I be able to control other ships (not my own)

No

Will I be able to spectate other players ships?

Yes!

The mod is about seeing other ships, you can spectate and look at them, look at the map and Vouila!

HAVE FUN!!!

Thanks -pasta549

Edited September 29, 2013 by pasta549
Sooo just to clarify, you can just sort of chat and see each other while you play, but aren't actually in the same game?

Ok, you really shouldn't turn off your firewall unless your router works as one for you.

Just set the exception for and forward the ports Hamachi uses.
Well I guess, if you want to put it that way, it's just sort of a check in program, where you can chat and spectate others ships and stuff, and yes you can use your own save
Personally, firewall doesn't do anything nor does it affect anything when turned on.

Guys he is just asking you to join his KerbalLiveFeed Server via Hamachi (a VPN provider)

@op

You don't exactly what a firewall does, correct? Classic firewalls might be mostly useless these days, since a common PC is in a "safe" network behind a router. But using a VPN is definitively sth you should use a firewall for.

Anyway, should not need to turn off your firewall, since the OS/Firewall should ask you when starting the program whether it shall be blocked or not. Just allow KLF and everything should be fine.
